abstract.text: A set of methods that an outline view calls to retrieve data and information about it from the data source delegate, and—optionally—to update data values.

content.text: Required and Optional Methods Using Programmatic Conventions and Cocoa Bindings

inlineContent.text: If you are using conventional data sources for content you must implement the basic methods that provide the outline view with data:
. Applications that acquire their data using Cocoa bindings do not need to implement these methods.
Similarly, when using conventional data sources , if you want to allow the user to edit values, you must implement
. When these methods are invoked by the outline view,

requires that each item in the outline view be unique. In order for the collapsed state of an outline view to remain consistent between reloads you must always return the same object for an item. When using Cocoa bindings to provide outline view content, there is no requirement to implement this method.
Some of the methods in this
along with other methods that return data, are called very frequently, so they must be efficient.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
A view that uses a row-and-column format to display hierarchical data like directories and files that can be expanded and collapsed.
A set of methods that an outline view calls to retrieve data and information about it from the data source delegate, and—optionally—to update data values.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a drop operation was successful.
Returns the child item at the specified index of a given item.
Implement this method to know when the given dragging session has ended.
Implement this method know when the given dragging session is about to begin and potentially modify the dragging session.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the a given item is expandable.

Invoked by an outline view to notify the data source that the descriptors changed and the data may need to be resorted.
